question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What position did Claude Bruguès hold in 2028?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Baton of Justice: Claude Bruguès, the Illustrious Bâtonnier

In the esteemed halls of the French legal profession, one name resonates with reverence and admiration: Claude Bruguès. For years, he has been the embodiment of excellence, integrity, and dedication to the pursuit of justice. It is no surprise, therefore, that he holds the prestigious position of bâtonnier, the head of the legal profession in France. As we delve into the life and career of Claude Bruguès, it becomes evident that his ascension to the esteemed office of bâtonnier was not a coincidence. Rather, it was the culmination of a lifetime of hard work, unwavering commitment, and an unrelenting passion for the law. Born and raised in France, Claude Bruguès was instilled with a strong sense of justice and a desire to make a difference in his community. He pursued his passion for the law with unbridled enthusiasm, earning his degree from a prestigious French university. His academic prowess and natural aptitude for the law soon earned him recognition among his peers, and he was sought after by top law firms in Paris. As a young lawyer, Claude Bruguès quickly made a name for himself in the legal circles of France. His exceptional advocacy skills, coupled with his in-depth knowledge of the law, earned him a reputation as a formidable litigator. His dedication to his clients and his unwavering commitment to justice soon earned him the respect and admiration of his colleagues. As his career progressed, Claude Bruguès became increasingly involved in the governance of the legal profession. He was elected to various leadership positions within the French bar association, where he worked tirelessly to promote the interests of lawyers and to uphold the highest standards of ethics and professionalism. It was only a matter of time before Claude Bruguès's exceptional leadership skills and his deep understanding of the legal profession would lead to his appointment as bâtonnier. This prestigious position, reserved for the most esteemed and respected members of the legal community, is a testament to his unwavering dedication to the pursuit of justice and his unrelenting commitment to the highest standards of excellence. As bâtonnier, Claude Bruguès has continued to inspire and lead the legal profession in France. He has worked tirelessly to promote access to justice, to protect the rights of the most vulnerable members of society, and to uphold the integrity of the legal system.
content.source_2: In the year 2029, the Catholic Church was undergoing a period of great change and renewal. As the world grappled with the challenges of the 21st century, the Church sought to adapt and respond to the needs of its faithful. It was against this backdrop that Claude Bruguès, a respected French lawyer, was appointed as the diocesan bishop of a prominent diocese. The date was January 11, 2029, and the news of Bruguès' appointment sent ripples of excitement throughout the Catholic community. As he took up his new role, Bruguès was acutely aware of the weight of responsibility that rested on his shoulders. He was tasked with guiding his diocese through a time of great uncertainty, and he was determined to lead with wisdom and compassion. Over the next two years, Bruguès worked tirelessly to build bridges between the Church and the wider community. He was a vocal advocate for social justice, and he used his platform to speak out against inequality and injustice. His leadership was marked by a sense of humility and empathy, and he quickly earned the respect and admiration of his flock. As the months passed, Bruguès' diocese began to flourish. The Church became a beacon of hope and comfort for those in need, and Bruguès' leadership was instrumental in this transformation. He worked closely with local community groups and organizations, building partnerships that would have a lasting impact on the region. But as the summer of 2031 approached, Bruguès knew that his time as diocesan bishop was drawing to a close. On July 6, 2031, he would step down from his position, leaving behind a legacy of service and devotion. As he looked back on his time in office, Bruguès felt a sense of pride and accomplishment. He had served his diocese with integrity and passion, and he knew that his work would continue to inspire and uplift generations to come. As Bruguès handed over the reins to his successor, he couldn't help but feel a sense of nostalgia wash over him. He had given his all to his diocese, and he knew that he would always cherish the memories of his time as diocesan bishop. But he also knew that his work was far from over. He would continue to serve the Church in new and different ways, using his skills and experience to make a positive impact on the world.
